p: A study conducted by Stawowczyk and colleagues showed that duck AvIFIT protein might be related to the induction of cell apoptosis, similar to human IFIT2 [ 304]. Another study found duck AvIFIT protein played a critical role in host immune response to H5N1. This was mediated by AvIFIT binding influenza NP protein, which increased the expression of IRF1, IRF7, IFNa, IFNb, TNFa, NF- kB and IL-12, which in turn magnified IFN signaling and arrested cell growth [ 305]. IL-36Î³, a key mediator of immune protection during IAV infection, promoted lung alveolar macrophage survival by decreasing apoptosis and limiting viral replication [ 306].
